keyTakeAways: Raila Odinga, a prominent Kenyan opposition leader and former prime minister, died at 80 from a suspected heart attack in southern India.
He was buried in Bondo, western Kenya, in a peaceful Anglican service with military honors, following a week of national grief and deadly stampedes.
Thousands of Kenyans and African dignitaries attended his funeral, highlighting his pan-African significance and legacy as a pro-democracy champion.
Odinga played a central role in restoring multi-party democracy in Kenya in the 1990s and in drafting the 2010 Constitution, which is widely praised.
He maintained shifting political alliances, including with former President Uhuru Kenyatta, President William Ruto, and others, showing political adaptability.
His death has created a leadership vacuum in Kenya’s opposition, raising concerns about political stability ahead of the 2027 election.
At least five people were killed and hundreds injured during public viewings and the burial due to surging crowds.
Odinga is affectionately known as 'Baba' and is seen as a selfless pan-Africanist, respected not just in Kenya but across the continent.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Raila Odinga, Kenya’s revered opposition leader and former prime minister, died at 80 from a suspected heart attack in southern India. His body was received in Nairobi, where it sparked a week of public mourning, including four public viewings that resulted in at least five deaths and hundreds of injuries due to stampedes. Despite the tragic crowds, his burial in Bondo was conducted peacefully with military honors and attendance from Kenyan and African leaders, including President William Ruto, former President Uhuru Kenyatta, and Nigeria’s former President Olusegun Obasanjo. Odinga is celebrated as a selfless pan-Africanist and key architect of Kenya’s return to multi-party democracy and the 2010 Constitution. His death has left a significant leadership vacuum in the opposition, raising concerns about political instability ahead of the 2027 election.
title: Kenya’s revered opposition leader Raila Odinga laid to rest
